head.title: Homage to a Classic, The Venerable Cube

hedline.hl1: Homage to a Classic, The Venerable Cube

abstract.p: Dakota Jackson designs chair that is reworking of Jean-Michel Frank's cube chair of 1930's; photo (Currents) (S)

block.p: Some people like to reinvent the wheel. Dakota Jackson, the New York furniture designer, has reworked the cube chair introduced in the 1930's by the French designer Jean-Michel Frank. Mr. Jackson's Grey (Territory) chair, shown at the International Contemporary Furniture Fair, is purposefully unassuming or, as Mr. Jackson said, ''easy to live with.'' The chair comes with a snap-on wool slipcover in gold, gray, red or off-white wool. The price is $3,584 (extra slipcovers are $975), at 979 Third Avenue (58th Street); (800) 776-9587.
